intro: Aria stankovii, commonly known as the Stankovii's lily, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Europe. It belongs to the Liliaceae family and is characterized by its striking white to pale pink flowers with a subtle fragrance. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has lance-shaped leaves with a waxy texture. Its flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer, and it is known for its ornamental value in horticulture. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered in its native range.
